channel.title: mediocre show
channel.description: Eric Tomorrow strives to be mediocre. Playing independent punk and hardcore, talking about their bizarre lives, and generally making fun of each other. and they have totally sweet asses.
channel.itunes:author: Eric Tomorrow
channel.itunes:subtitle: subtitle: Since 2005 The mediocre show has been bringing you independent talk radio that is strikingly average. Eric Tomorrow, Hope and Mike Pilot broadcast weekly live from Philadelphia, to a group of dedicated worldwide fans that call themselves the Mediocre Nation. The show features weekly segments, listener calls, and independent music. The Mediocre Show is not a zainy morning zoo program filled with stunts and whacky hi-jinx, it’s 2 guys that aren’t afraid to tell you what you should be thinking. Tune in every week at 8pm eastern on arecibo radio, as well as video clips. Call us live at 610.624.1702, or you can leave us a voicemail at 206.666.5900. Sit back, grab yourself a beer, and enjoy your journey to the middle of the road. You are the Mediocre Nation.

channel.itunes:keywords: mediocre podcast, films, carolla, last comic standing, mediocre, show, ninja, comedy, punk, metal, eric, tomorrow, kevin smith

item.title: mediocre 398 (best of 2011)
item.description:
It's mid July and you know what that means... The show is on vacation. South Philly Paul won't let that keep you from hearing your weekly dose of Mediocre! He took time out of his weekend to clip out the very finest moments of the show over the past year.
Many thanks to SPP for making this best of show possible. If you disagree with the clips, then I guess you should have given up your weekend and sent clips yourself.
Go Fuck Yourself!
Love, Mike

item.title: Pork Milk
item.description: The Mediocre show audience in the ongoing debate of "One meat to rule them all"; team beef has grown strong and has gloated the attributes of milk and cheese to their protein. Cheese seems to be the trump card of the debates. Eric Tomorrow, host of the show and champion of team pork, not only asked the question, "How do you know pig milk is gross?". Eric set out to prove once and for all that pork is the meat to rule them all, follow him on his quest to acquire and taste pig's milk. His grass roots approach is not to be missed. Eric is not afraid to get dirty and the Mediocre show travels to Utah to get the answers. Eric visits gourmet, green, sustainable farmers in his quest, nay duty to find the answers.

item.title: mediocre 376 (live in salt lake)
item.description:
recorded live 3/19/11 at brewvies in salt lake city in front of a live audience.
this is the place where i would normally tell you what we talked about on the show, but i figure this space is better used to tell you about the entire weekend in salt lake. never in my life have i felt so welcomed in a city i had never really been to before. never have i felt more important than i did when visiting salt lake city. no amount of voicemails or emails can ever compare to seeing faces in the crowd, and hearing laughs come back at you. in the nearly 6 years i have been doing this show, nothing has ever compared to all the events in utah this past weekend. and as i always say, without you we wouldn't be doing this, and i mean that more than ever. you people gave us an even bigger drive to succeed, because we can't bear the idea of letting you all down. you are an amazing group of people, and we are so lucky to have you as part of the nation. thank you for everything you do for/to us. and thank you for being such an amazing and caring group of people. i wish we could do that every day.
/eric
now please to be enjoying the live show from SLC we had a great time doing it and i hope you all enjoy it too.
thanks to everyone involved in making this happen. we will have a list and talk more in detail about it next week.

item.title: mediocre 347 (the show that almost wasn't)
item.description:
recorded live 11/3/10 at 8pm eastern or arecibo radio.
let's get this right out on front street, we had a bit of a software meltdown on this show, and lost the entire recording. thinking that all was lost, in steps our newest sponsor to the show www.fumo.biz who happened to be recording the live stream from his home. if that doesn't start off a sponsorship on the right foot and make the nation fall in love with him, i don't know what will. please send them a note of thanks for not only supporting the show, but also saving episode 347.
that being said, the audio quality is not quite what you are used to but the show is 95% there, and we can be thankful for that, this in the month of thanksgiving. also, please do not follow any advice given by eric during this episode, it was not sound advice.
thank you to all the scorpions of support.
thanks for listening. (i really do mean that.)

item.title: mediocre 340 (sadness hole)
item.description:
recorded 10/6/10 at 8pm eastern on arecibo radio.
re·splend·ent/riˈsplendənt/
Adjective: Attractive and impressive through being richly colorful or sumptuous.
old b and e.
no rabbit rabbit.
sadnesshole.
evil kenevil of tiny go karts.
jeff vice gets a little randy.
aww shucks.
no fanfare?
matt's text:
I'm glad that your team has one small victory. I hope that has sustained you through years of abject pity and what can only be expected to be years of continued irrelevance. It must be nice for you to have one victory with a quarterback that won't be there in 2 years, for a team run by a meglamoniacal imbecile, who will not EVER have a viaible team due to his meddling. Your team Is the goofus to the cowboys gallant. I hope this win will sustain you through your lack of a playoff run, you won nothing, it was used to you by our temporarily inept team. Happy day. F*** your life.
**dickies jackets in the store NOW!**
hoodies to follow.
thank you to all the new scorpions of support.
thanks for listening. (i really do mean that.)

item.title: mediocre 336 (prophet margin)
item.description:
this is yet another solo mediocre show with eric tomorrow.
the mediocre show's favorite kid ever had surgery on 9/22/10 to have her tonsils removed, and because mike is a great dad, he took the week off from the show to be with her and take care of her. you will all be glad to know she is doing great and feeling much better, because she is a total trooper. that being said, i thought i would make a solo show for you guys to enjoy, or at least endure, so at some point in the future you can tell your grandkids you did in fact listen to every episode of the mediocre show, that is, if you have heard episode 1. there are a few still listening who have, but the vast majority of you have not heard it, and truthfully, you are better off having not heard it.
at any rate, in this installment, eric tackles such hard hitting issues as: amish contractors, the film industry, jeff vice, the word retard, buick vehicles, the SLC listener party. and so on.
please enjoy, and join us at our regular time next week on areciboradio.com

item.title: mediocre 306 (three dollar ball chicken)
item.description:

Y is unacceptable, Eric will allow IE.
unpleasant jerking.
Mik-E loses his mind for about 5 minutes, don't delete him as a friend. Oodles of HOPE including some live advice.
check out beefy's new record "with sprinkles" at http://beefy.bandcamp.com
Flyers.
Toasts.
the return of Mos Jef.
you are so dumb with your drugs.

item.title: mediocre 98 (open arms)
item.description:
mediocre 98 (open arms)
in the highly anticipated episode 98 of the mediocre show, our heros eric and taylor fight evil and wrongdoing, as they have for the last 97 episodes, however this time, there is a fork in the road. see who gets voted off this week, and who moves on to the semi finals to compete for the title. the title of what you ask? quite frankly i'm not sure, but rest assured, it's exciting, like, you totally have a huge boner just thinking about it. rock solid. people will write sonnets about this majestic beast. perhaps a broadway musical, i can say without a doubt it'll be the new "git er done" every truck stop will stock a shirt with it on there. you won't be able to ignore it, but why would you, it'll change your life, FOR THE BETTER. but yeah, here's the new show. stop thinking about your boner, and grow up.
www.mediocreshow.com / 206.666.5900
go to the website and enter the raffle for a brand new engraved ipod nano and other great prizes.

it's been a few weeks. you know that, we know that, let's get past it.
we had some computer trouble. hardware/software/then hardware again.
it's not as though we took a vacation, in fact it has been more stressful than normal for us. so, it seems as though you survived the time without it, and for that i applaud you.
now, on to the business:
as you can imagine, we had quite a backlog of voicemails. we do our best to wade our way through them. we also had a special guest on the show, by the name of alex, he's a tattoo artist.
also, we had some corrections.
some beautiful singing from the mediocre nation.
some confessions, and believe it or not, that took over 2 hours. so i guess we'll save the love/hates, and trucker buddy for episode 97. which will be coming when taylor gets back from riding his new motorcycle from arizona to portland.
thanks for sticking with us, and we have some exciting announcements coming very soon. but in the meantime you should donate to the show so we can get some new gear and avoid delays like this in the future.
call us, we miss you as much as you missed us.
206.666.5900 / www.mediocreshow.com

how bout a haiku?
yeah lets do that.
mediocre show.
trucker buddy lost his job.
we still have our jobs.
so anyway, that was my haiku.
hope you enjoyed it.
i really feel like i am talking to myself here.
oh well, just in case here is the info: www.mediocreshow.com / 206.666.5900
